name: Tikka Masala
summary: Grilled chunks of chicken enveloped in a creamy spiced tomato sauce.
method: Mix the chicken with yogurt and garam masala, let it marinate for at least 1 hour, or overnight if possible.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add the marinated chicken and cook until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, sauté onions and garlic until onions are translucent.
Add crushed tomatoes to the skillet and bring to a simmer. Return the chicken to the skillet, cover, and let it simmer for about 20 minutes.
Stir in the cream, season with salt, and cook for another 10 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

name: Shepard's Pie
summary: Savory pie filled with cooked meat, vegetables, and topped with a mashed potato crust.
method: Boil the potatoes in salted water until tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain and mash with milk and butter until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
In a large skillet, cook the ground meat over medium heat until browned. Remove excess fat.
Add onions and carrots to the skillet and cook until softened. Stir in the tomato paste and cook for another 2 minutes.
Add the frozen peas and broth, bring to a simmer, and cook for about 10 minutes until slightly reduced. Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the meat mixture to an ovenproof dish. Spread the mashed potatoes over the top. If using, sprinkle with grated cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the top is golden and crispy.
Serve hot.

name: Beef Stroganoff
summary: A classic comfort food featuring tender beef and creamy mushroom sauce.
method: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef slices and cook until browned. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add more oil if needed, and cook onions and mushrooms until soft, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for another minute.
Return the beef to the skillet. Add beef broth, Worcestershire sauce, and Dijon mustard. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in sour cream and season with salt and pepper to taste. Heat through, ensuring not to boil, for about 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook egg noodles in a large pot of boiling water according to package instructions until al dente. Drain.
Serve the beef and sauce over the cooked egg noodles.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
summary: Classic Italian pasta dish with a rich, meaty sauce.
method: Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat and cook chopped onion until translucent.
Add ground beef to the pan, breaking it apart. Cook until browned and season with salt and pepper.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, and beef stock or water. Simmer for 30 mins.
While the sauce simmers, cook spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over the cooked spaghetti.

name: Chicken Parmesan
summary: Crispy, breaded chicken breasts topped with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese.
method: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Dip each breast into the beaten egg, then coat with a mixture of breadcrumbs and grated Parmesan cheese.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry the chicken until golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Place the fried chicken in a baking dish. Top each breast with marinara sauce and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot.
